definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: There are many schools on modern business-cycle theory, which hold different views and ideas.
sentences.chinese: 現代經濟週期理論派別林立，觀點各異。

sentences.english: Why does the stock price fluctuates unconventionally during the economic cycle.
sentences.chinese: 中國股票市場在經濟週期中波動異常的原因何在？

sentences.english: So changes to house prices aggravate the economic cycle.
sentences.chinese: 因此房價的變動使經濟週期惡化。

sentences.english: Many are braced for the first squeeze on the economy when VAT is increased at midnight tomorrow night.
sentences.chinese: 當增值稅在明晚上升，許多都擠在第一個經濟週期內。

sentences.english: Undulate theoretical influence to the economic period.
sentences.chinese: 對經濟週期波動理論的影響。

sentences.english: Seamless experts said it is mainly determined by the economic cycle.
sentences.chinese: 無縫管專家表示這主要是由經濟週期決定的。

sentences.english: The direct cause of formation of business cycles is that aggregate demand doesn't comply with aggregate supply.
sentences.chinese: 經濟週期的直接成因是總需求與總供給的不一致。

sentences.english: Growth and volatility are the characteristic features of growing economic cycle.
sentences.chinese: 增長性和波動性是增長型經濟週期的典型特徵。

sentences.english: It is as if the economic cycle has been written out of the textbooks.
sentences.chinese: 他們的言辭如此肯定好像教科書早已寫明瞭經濟週期。

definition: variant of 戰略伙伴|战略伙伴[zhan4 lu:e4 huo3 ban4]
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
lit. pull one hair and the whole body moves/fig. a slight change will affect everything else/the butterfly effect
pinyin: qian1 yi1 fa4 er2 dong4 quan2 shen1
